fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.filter

Interface IFilterBuilder


  • public interface IFilterBuilder
    Builds filters that can be applied to lists fetched from a connector data source.
    • any() (logical OR) and all() (logical AND) build a filter based on boolean algebra logic (corresponding to SQL SELECT functionality).
      • Choosing any() builds a filter where at least one top-level criterion must match.
      • Choosing all() builds a filter where all top-level criteria must match.
      • When there is only one criterion, either method can be used.
      • More complex filters can be constructed using conjunctions (nested logical AND criteria) and disjunctions (nested logical OR criteria).
      • Once built, use the toFilter() method of the resulting logic criteria object to create the filter object that can be used by a connector data source when fetching lists.
    • search(string) builds a full-text query (corresponding to classic Internet-style search engine functionality).
    • importFilter(stream) restores any previously exported filter that applies to the associated connecter data source.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe. This thread safety guarantee does not extend to all objects returned by methods of this class.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IConjunction all()
      Starts building a criteria-based logic filter, where all top-level criteria are combined using logical AND semantics.
      IDisjunction any()
      Starts building a criteria-based logic filter, where all top-level criteria are combined using logical OR semantics.
      IFilter importFilter(InputStream stream)
      Imports a filter definition by reading data from a stream.
      IFilter importFilter(Object representation)
      Imports a filter definition by converting a supported object type to a filter instance.
      ISearchFilter search(String queryText)
      Builds a full-text search filter using the supplied query text.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        ISearchFilter search(String queryText)
              throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Builds a full-text search filter using the supplied query text. The syntax of the query text is not defined here, and is implementation-dependent,

        Invoking this method yields a new filter instance unrelated to any other filter instances produced using this builder object via the any(), all(), and search(text) methods.

        Parameters:
        queryText - the non-null implementation-dependent query text.
        Returns:
        the full text search filter builder.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the connector cannot build a search filter for the associated data source (or if it cannot be combined with a logic filter, if such a filter has already been created by this filter builder).
        Since:
        1.0

      • all

        IConjunction all()
          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Starts building a criteria-based logic filter, where all top-level criteria are combined using logical AND semantics.

        Criteria can be appended using method chaining; care should be taken to apply the required logic if chaining methods and using nested criteria sets (in other words, take care not to get lost in the branches of the logic tree).

        Invoking this method yields a new criteria set instance unrelated to any other criteria set instance created using this builder object via the any(), all(), and search(text) methods.

        Returns:
        the criteria-based logical AND filter.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the connector cannot build a criteria-based logic filter for the associated data source (or if it cannot be combined with a search filter, if such a filter has already been created by this filter builder).
        Since:
        1.0

      • any

        IDisjunction any()
          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Starts building a criteria-based logic filter, where all top-level criteria are combined using logical OR semantics.

        Criteria can be appended using method chaining; care should be taken to apply the required logic if chaining methods and using nested criteria sets (in other words, take care not to get lost in the branches of the logic tree).

        Invoking this method yields a new criteria set instance unrelated to any other criteria set instance created using this builder object via the any(), all(), and search(text) methods.

        Returns:
        the criteria-based logical OR filter.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the connector cannot build a criteria-based logic filter for the associated data source (or if it cannot be combined with a search filter, if such a filter has already been created by this filter builder).
        Since:
        1.0

      • importFilter

        IFilter importFilter(InputStream stream)
              throws IOException
        Imports a filter definition by reading data from a stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - non-null stream to read from. The stream will not be closed by this method.
        Returns:
        the imported filter definition.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the definition cannot be imported from the supplied stream.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFilter.exportFilter(java.io.OutputStream)

      • importFilter

        IFilter importFilter(Object representation)
        Imports a filter definition by converting a supported object type to a filter instance.
        Parameters:
        representation - non-null object that can be converted to an instance of IFilter by this implementation.
        Returns:
        the imported filter definition.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the requested conversion is not supported by this implementation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFilter.exportFilterAs(Class)
